discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
With Option 66 you can actually have multiple TFTP servers referenced within DNS if you use FQDN. However, the most applicable answer where both options are presented is C.
There is another question which only has the Option 66 for one TFTP server. In that instance Option 66 is correct. In this case, since we have 2 TFTP servers, it would be Option 150

Selected Answer: C
Option 66 provides a single TFTP server address. Option 150 provides a list of TFTP server addresses. Also if both are configured, Cisco phones will target 150 by default before 66.

questions.question_text: An engineer is configuring IP telephony. The network relies on DHCP to provide TFTP server addresses to the endpoints. Policy requires the endpoints to receive two server addresses. Which DHCP option must be configured?
